title: How to Connect a Car Stereo for House Use With a Psu

steps.headline: Depending on year and model of PSU, there may have different color wires.
steps.description: on my PSU, there are black, blue, yellow, orange, red, and green.

steps.headline: Try to eliminate blue, orange, red and green.
Now all the yellow wires using the wire strippers, strip them approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm).
Now do the same procedure for the black wires.
Strip black, red, and yellow wires.
Now twist yellow and red wires together.
Connect both yellow and red wires to the psu (YELLOW!)
Connect black wire with black on psu.
Leave switch off and plug power supply in outlet.

text: On the PSU Disconnect all power from PSU.  Depending on year and model of PSU, there may have different color wires. on my PSU, there are black, blue, yellow, orange, red, and green. Try to eliminate blue, orange, red and green.  Now all the yellow wires using the wire strippers, strip them approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm).  Twist all yellow cords together.  Now do the same procedure for the black wires.  On Stereo Strip black, red, and yellow wires.  Now twist yellow and red wires together.  Connect both yellow and red wires to the psu (YELLOW!) wire. Connect black wire with black on psu.  Leave switch off and plug power supply in outlet.
sentences: On the PSU Disconnect all power from PSU.
Depending on year and model of PSU, there may have different color wires.
on my PSU, there are black, blue, yellow, orange, red, and green.
Try to eliminate blue, orange, red and green.
Now all the yellow wires using the wire strippers, strip them approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm).
Now do the same procedure for the black wires.
On Stereo Strip black, red, and yellow wires.
Now twist yellow and red wires together.
Connect both yellow and red wires to the psu (YELLOW!)
Connect black wire with black on psu.
Leave switch off and plug power supply in outlet.
